page.title: 10Sheep farming in Rhenigidale
page.content: {SPRING}At this time the lambs are born. It is a very busy time. Usually every year there will be 1 or more orphan lambs that have to be fed by a bottle of milk. Nearly everywhere there are lambs jumping about. Some are born early and some late. {SUMMER}This is the time for shearing. In Rhenigidale they don't use electric shears but the old hand shears. They are not as quick and easy to use but they work just as well. {AUTUMN}All the sheep get dipped at this time. The dip mixture is mixed with water in a tank. The sheep are caught and put into the tank. The whole body is pushed under for one minute. After that the sheep climb onto a dripper platform to dry out. The female sheep go to the ram towards the end of November.
